value.title: Search Bar in Power BI Slicer
value.excerpt: If you have too many items in a slicer, such as the list of customer names, or product names, then finding one amongst the list takes time, unless you enable the search. Fortunately, the search is there for you, you just need to enable it, In this very short article and video, Iâ€™ll explain where it is

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #01: Filters are tables

value.title: Creating real time dashboards in Power BI with push datasets
value.excerpt: Though you can build real-time reports with DirectQuery, push datasets offer a more scalable, economical, and effective solution especially when combined with an Import model already in place. This video introduces the architecture of push datasets. Article and download: https://www.sqlbi.com/?p=729917&aff=yt

value.title: Using ALLEXCEPT vs ALL VALUES
value.excerpt: ALLEXCEPT is a handy DAX function to retrieve all the columns of a table except for some. When used as a CALCULATE modifier, its behavior is less intuitive and might result in inaccurate measures. In this video, we elaborate on the most common mistake when using ALLEXCEPT in CALCULATE. Article and download:

value.title: When to use KEEPFILTERS over iterators
value.excerpt: How to use KEEPFILTERS in DAX iterator functions to preserve arbitrarily shaped filters in context transition.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/705054?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.
